Legal Entity Selection

This section is crucial as it determines the legal framework under which your application will be processed. You must carefully choose the legal entity type that accurately reflects your business structure. The options provided include:

  • Corporation: A separate legal entity that can enter contracts, own assets, and be liable for debts independently from its shareholders. Suitable for larger businesses with complex structures.
  • Partnership: An agreement where two or more individuals share ownership and management responsibilities of the business. Partnerships can be general, limited, or joint ventures.
  • Sole Proprietorship: A business owned and operated by one person, where there is no legal distinction between the owner and the business entity. This is ideal for small businesses and self-employed individuals.

Before making your selection, consult with a legal advisor or business consultant to ensure that you choose the entity that best suits your business needs. After selecting your entity type, click 'Submit' to proceed to the next stage of your application.
